page.title: 15Local Government : Middleton
page.content: Middleton and Smerrill Parish Council formed in 1976 has 5 councillors. A parish Clerk keeps the records. A penny rate amounting to Â£180 is levied each year to finance Parish projects. Money raising events are organised with the Village Hall Entertainments Committee. The Village Hall has been redecorated, central heating installed and a Public Lavatory installed. Rent is charged for activities in the Hall. The Parish Council deal with planning applications for new houses and alterations to existing property. They have installed street lights outside the Village Hall, in the Square and near the Church. The playground has been resurfaced and a picnic site developed. Local Government is in 3 tiers County, District and Parish Councils. The Peak Park Planning Board have also assisted with projects.
